result.execSummary:
The defendant Hayley M Burris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 32 Days.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.
Concurrent with: Milwaukee County Sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash Bail Applied.  Paid In Full.  To be paid Joint and Several with Co-Defendant
Cash Bail Applied to Costs and Surcharge.  Paid In Full.  Remaining bail to be refunded to poster.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
Be involved in a 12 step program 2 times a week.  Obtain a sponsor/mentor within 30 days.  Start attending within 1 week of release.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign Medical Release for Agent.
Maintain a valid driver's license.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
No contact with:  Co-Defendant.
Provide DNA Sample if not yet and pay surcharge.

Case #14CF1228 was Dismissed and Read into Case #14CF1459.
